brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the frequency of Fabry disease in children with
      chronic abdominal pain or chronic pain in the extremities

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening for Fabry Disease in a Pediatric Population at Risk

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age below 18 years

          -  One of the following criteria:

               -  Diagnosis or suspicion of a rheumatological disorder with recurrent complaints
                  for more than 6 months

               -  Chronic, recurrent abdominal pain for more than 6 months

          -  Planned blood sample for routine diagnostics

          -  Written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

        - Patient and/or the patient's parent(s) or legal guardian(s) are unable to understand the
        nature, scope, and possible consequences of the screening.

study_pop.textblock: Children with rheumatological disorders or chronic abdominal pain

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ethikkommission der Medizinischen Fakultät Heidelberg

reference.citation: Ries M, Gupta S, Moore DF, Sachdev V, Quirk JM, Murray GJ, Rosing DR, Robinson C, Schaefer E, Gal A, Dambrosia JM, Garman SC, Brady RO, Schiffmann R. Pediatric Fabry disease. Pediatrics. 2005 Mar;115(3):e344-55. Epub 2005 Feb 15. PubMed

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Markus Ries, MD PhD MHSc FCP

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Fabry disease in predefined sub-populations

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
